description: PATSTAT application identification. Surrogate key: Technical unique identifier without any business meaning
name: appln_id

description: PATSTAT Patent publication identification. Surrogate key for patent publications.
name: pat_publn_id

description: Identifier of a DOCDB simple family. Means that most probably the applications share exactly the same priorities (Paris Convention or technical relation or others).
name: docdb_family_id

description: Identifier of an INPADOC extended priority family. Means that the applications share a priority directly or indirectly via a third application.
name: inpadoc_family_id

fields.description: Country code of the *cited* patent. Parsed by GROBID.
fields.name: country_code

fields.description: Original number of the *cited* patent. Parsed by GROBID.
fields.name: original_number

fields.description: Kind code of the *cited* patent. Parsed by GROBID.
fields.name: kind_code

fields.description: The status of the *cited* patent. Parsed by GROBID.
fields.name: status

fields.description: Concatenation of country code, original number and kind code of the *cited* patent. Based on attributes parsed attributes.
fields.name: pubnum

fields.description: Publication number of the *cited* patent. Obtained from the google patent linking API (https://patents.google.com/api/match?pubnum=<pubnum> with <pubnum>=CONCAT(country_code,original_number)). *Not validated yet*.
fields.name: publication_number

fields.description: Publication date (yyyymmdd) of the *cited* patent based on the matched publication_number.
fields.name: publication_date

fields.description: PATSTAT application identification of the *cited* patent. Based on the matched publication_number. Surrogate key: Technical unique identifier without any business meaning.
fields.name: appln_id

fields.description: PATSTAT Patent publication identification of the *cited* patent. Based on the matched publication_number. Surrogate key for patent publications.
fields.name: pat_publn_id

fields.description: Identifier of a DOCDB simple family of the *cited* patent. Based on the matched publication_number. Means that most probably the applications share exactly the same priorities (Paris Convention or technical relation or others).
fields.name: docdb_family_id

fields.description: Identifier of an INPADOC extended priority family of the *cited* patent. Based on the matched publication_number. Means that the applications share a priority directly or indirectly via a third application.
fields.name: inpadoc_family_id

fields.description: Flag detected citations which are likely to be in the header than in the specification itself. Flag is True for citations extracted from patents published in the pre-1976 format and with all occurrences detected before character 50. It is recommended to exclude those citations from most analyses.
fields.name: flag

fields.description: First character of the detected *cited* patent. Refers to description_localized.text in patents-public-data.patents.publications.
fields.name: char_start

fields.description: Last character of the detected *cited* patent. Refers to description_localized.text in patents-public-data.patents.publications.
fields.name: char_end
